info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 27 at 2:21PM EST until February 27 at 3:15PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Clinton County in northern New York... Southern Franklin County in northern New York... Southeastern St. Lawrence County in northern New York... Central Essex County in northern New York... Lamoille County in northwestern Vermont... Orleans County in northeastern Vermont... Northwestern Essex County in northeastern Vermont... Northwestern Addison County in central Vermont... Grand Isle County in northwestern Vermont... Chittenden County in northwestern Vermont... Northwestern Washington County in central Vermont... Franklin County in northwestern Vermont... * Until 315 PM EST. * At 219 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Rouses Point to near Onchiota to Pitcairn, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts in excess of 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. Multiple videos have confirmed whiteout conditions within this snow squall. Observed wind gusts of up to 40 MPH have been reported by ASOS and mesonet. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 87 north of Elizabethtown. Interstate 89 between mile markers 67 and 130. Interstate 91 between mile markers 155 and 174. Locations impacted include... Essex Junction, Plattsburgh International Airport, Burlington, Tupper Lake, Burlington International Airport, Saranac Lake, Adirondack Regional Airport, Plattsburgh, Newport City, South Burlington, Lake Placid, Peru, Beekmantown, Schuyler Falls, Oswegatchie, Chazy, Saranac, Willsboro, Morrisville and Enosburg Falls. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
